results.title: The Name of the game is volleyball
results.brief_description: Explains how volleyball is played. Points out that the game is basically simple to play, does not require expensive equipment and can be enjoyed by anyone.

results.title: The Name of the cloud is ignorance
results.creator_credit: Richard Bigham, British Leprosy Relief Association and H.D. Trust
results.brief_description: The causes and cure of leprosy, showing what is being done in India to educate people about the true nature of the disease, the treatment given at mobile clinics and surgery to recover mobility of affected muscles and tendons. Awarded the Premio San Giorgio (Venice Film Festival, 1965).

results.title: The Myths of shoplifting
results.creator_credit: Doug Jacoby, Doris Storm, Frank Jacoby, Churchill Films and M T I Teleprograms
results.brief_description: The increased incidence of shoplifting has meant increasingly sophisticated security and surveillance systems are installed in retail stores. The popular myths about shoplifting are examined and negated. This film contains six vignettes emphasising that shoplifting is a real crime with real consequences. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Myth of the bush
results.creator_credit: Berry-Anne Billingsley, ABC-TV (Australia) and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description: Looks at the Heidelberg School of artists who are considered to be the first group of painters to capture the unique colours of the Australian landscape. Traces the artists’ history from their beginnings at Box Hill where Tom Roberts painted “Artists Camp”, to their first exhibition which concentrated on paintings executed at Heidelberg.

results.title: The Mystery single vehicle crash
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”
Although many drivers involved in single vehicle crashes attribute the cause of their accidents to mechanical failures of the car, very often it was the driver and not the car who was to blame. This film stresses that while mechanical checks of one’s car are most important, it is even more vital that the driver is in good physical and mental condition before taking to the road.

results.title: The Mysterious Mr Tesla
results.brief_description: It was Tesla, not Edison, who invented the method of transmitting electricity which makes the 20th century work. In the 1890s Tesla also demonstrated the wireless two years before Marconi. Now a growing number of Tesla enthusiasts claim that his later research was 80 years ahead of its time.

results.title: The Mysterious bee (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Simon, Australian Film Commission and Phil Simon Nature Films
results.brief_description: Through the use of macro photography and slow motion filming, Phil Simon takes the viewer into the world of the honey bee. We see, first hand, the life cycle of the drone, the worker and the queen bee and their roles and interaction with each other in the colony. A highlight of the video is the fight to the death of two queen bees. Advice is also given on how to keep and handle bees.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Simon, Australian Film Commission and Phil Simon Nature Films

results.title: The Mysteries of blood: haemostasis and blood coagulation
results.creator_credit: Masami Sugiyama, Eiji Murayama and Sakura Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: It is needless to point out the important role played by the blood for the maintenance of human life and health. In particular, the real fact about blood coagulation is one of the principal problems attracting the attention of modern medical science. This film is intended to show the complicated and clever functions concealed in the simple fact of blood coagulation. Several hitherto unsolved problems have been clarified and new spheres have been presented for future study by this film.

results.title: The Mutton birds of Bass Strait
results.brief_description: A study of the species of mutton bird which appear in large numbers in the Furneaux Islands off North east Tasmania, and which are the basis of a successful commercial undertaking on the Islands. The film depicts preparations for the breeding season, harvesting, cleaning, packing and distribution. Investigations into the biology the the mutton bird commenced in 1947 to determine whether intensive harvesting was depleting the rookeries.
